meanings.definition: A lease of a property by a tenant to a subtenant.
meanings.sent1: The subleases of the apartments in the building helped the tenant cover their rent.
meanings.sent2: The subleases of the office spaces were managed efficiently by the property manager.
meanings.sent3: The subleases of the parking spots led to a funny mix-up when two subtenants claimed the same spot.
meanings.sent4: The subleases of the rooms created a web of interconnected agreements among the tenants.
meanings.sent5: The subleases of the land were like branches extending from the main lease agreement.

meanings.definition: To lease or rent all or part of a leased property.
meanings.sent1: She subleases her extra office space to freelancers looking for a quiet place to work.
meanings.sent2: They sublease the warehouse to a small business for storage purposes.
meanings.sent3: He subleases his parking spot to his neighbor, making a little extra money each month.
meanings.sent4: Subleasing the storefront allowed the business owner to reduce their monthly expenses.
meanings.sent5: Subleasing the equipment helped the company generate additional revenue.
